meanings.definition: Make (something) global or worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The company globalized its products by selling them in many countries.
meanings.sent2: Businesses often globalize their operations to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of globalizing a pet rock business might sound silly, but who knows, it could be a hit worldwide!
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter globalized the joy in the room, spreading happiness to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire of rumors globalized quickly, reaching every corner of the small town in no time.

meanings.sent1: The tech company globalized its software to connect users from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: Social media platforms have globalized communication, allowing people to interact internationally.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to globalize her menu by adding dishes from different countries, creating a fusion cuisine.
meanings.sent4: His music globalized the sounds of his culture, blending traditional melodies with modern beats.
meanings.sent5: The internet has globalized access to information, making knowledge easily accessible to anyone with a connection.
